text: Resetting your AirPods can be a quick fix
for any bugs you may be experiencing.

This method will work for
regular AirPods and AirPods Pro.
Before beginning the resetting process,
make sure your AirPods are in their case

with the lid closed for
at least 30 seconds.

To begin, open the lid
on your AirPods case
and set them to the side.
Next, go to your iPhone settings
and click "Bluetooth."

Find your AirPods you're
resetting under "MY DEVICES."
Then click the info icon next to them.

Now at the bottom, click
"Forget This Device"
and follow the on-screen prompts.
With the AirPod case still open,
hold down the setup button on the back
for about 15 seconds

until the light inside
between the headphones
starts flashing amber.

Finally, follow the instructions
on your phone screen
to set your AirPods up again.
